when_to_say: Used as a general greeting during the daytime, typically from late morning to early evening.
example: こんにちは、元気ですか？ (konnichiwa, genki desu ka?) - Hello, how are you?

when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in informal settings with friends and family.
example: ありがとう、手伝ってくれて！ (arigatou, tetsudatte kurete!) - Thank you for helping me!

when_to_say: Used to greet someone in the morning, typically until around 10-11 AM.
example: おはよう！よく眠れた？ (ohayou! yoku nemureta?) - Good morning! Did you sleep well?

when_to_say: Used when parting ways, especially when you won't see the person for a while.
example: さようなら、また会いましょう (sayounara, mata aimashou) - Goodbye, let's meet again

when_to_say: Used to apologize, get someone's attention, or express gratitude politely.
example: すみません、道を教えてください (sumimasen, michi wo oshiete kudasai) - Excuse me, please tell me the way

when_to_say: Used to agree, confirm, or acknowledge something in formal and informal situations.
example: はい、わかりました (hai, wakarimashita) - Yes, I understood

when_to_say: Used to disagree, deny, or refuse something politely.
example: いいえ、大丈夫です (iie, daijoubu desu) - No, it's okay

when_to_say: Used when going to bed or saying goodnight to someone.
example: おやすみなさい、また明日 (oyasuminasai, mata ashita) - Good night, see you tomorrow

when_to_say: Used to politely request something or ask someone to do something.
example: 水をください (mizu wo kudasai) - Please give me water

when_to_say: Used to apologize sincerely for a mistake or wrongdoing.
example: ごめんなさい、遅れました (gomen nasai, okuremashita) - I'm sorry, I'm late

when_to_say: Used when talking about family in general or one's own family.
example: 私の家族は四人です (watashi no kazoku wa yonin desu) - My family has four people

when_to_say: Used when referring to one's own father when speaking to others.
example: 父は会社員です (chichi wa kaishain desu) - My father is a company employee

when_to_say: Used when referring to one's own mother when speaking to others.
example: 母は料理が上手です (haha wa ryouri ga jouzu desu) - My mother is good at cooking

when_to_say: Used when referring to one's own older brother.
example: 兄は大学生です (ani wa daigakusei desu) - My older brother is a university student

when_to_say: Used when referring to one's own older sister.
example: 姉は東京に住んでいます (ane wa toukyou ni sunde imasu) - My older sister lives in Tokyo

when_to_say: Used when referring to one's own younger brother.
example: 弟は高校生です (otouto wa koukousei desu) - My younger brother is a high school student

when_to_say: Used when referring to one's own younger sister.
example: 妹はピアノが好きです (imouto wa piano ga suki desu) - My younger sister likes piano

when_to_say: Used when referring to friends in casual conversation.
example: 友達と映画を見ました (tomodachi to eiga wo mimashita) - I watched a movie with my friend

when_to_say: Used when addressing or referring to a teacher, doctor, or expert.
example: 田中先生は英語の先生です (tanaka sensei wa eigo no sensei desu) - Mr. Tanaka is an English teacher

when_to_say: Used when referring to a student at any educational level.
example: 私は日本語の学生です (watashi wa nihongo no gakusei desu) - I am a Japanese language student

when_to_say: Used when counting or expressing the number one.
example: 一つください (hitotsu kudasai) - Please give me one

when_to_say: Used when counting or expressing the number two.
example: 二人で行きます (futari de ikimasu) - Two people will go

when_to_say: Used when counting or expressing the number three.
example: 三時に会いましょう (sanji ni aimashou) - Let's meet at 3 o'clock

when_to_say: Used when talking about time duration or hours.
example: 二時間勉強しました (nijikan benkyou shimashita) - I studied for two hours

when_to_say: Used when referring to the present moment.
example: 今、忙しいです (ima, isogashii desu) - I'm busy now

when_to_say: Used when referring to the morning time period.
example: 朝ご飯を食べました (asagohan wo tabemashita) - I ate breakfast

when_to_say: Used when referring to noon or daytime hours.
example: 昼ご飯は何ですか (hirugohan wa nan desu ka) - What is lunch?

when_to_say: Used when referring to nighttime or evening hours.
example: 夜は家にいます (yoru wa ie ni imasu) - I'm at home at night

when_to_say: Used when referring to the current day.
example: 今日は晴れです (kyou wa hare desu) - It's sunny today

when_to_say: Used when referring to the day after today.
example: 明日、東京に行きます (ashita, toukyou ni ikimasu) - I'll go to Tokyo tomorrow

when_to_say: Used when referring to food in general.
example: 日本の食べ物が好きです (nihon no tabemono ga suki desu) - I like Japanese food

when_to_say: Used when referring to water as a beverage or substance.
example: 水を飲みます (mizu wo nomimasu) - I drink water

when_to_say: Used when referring to tea, especially green tea.
example: お茶を入れましょうか (ocha wo iremashou ka) - Shall I make tea?

when_to_say: Used when referring to cooked rice or a meal in general.
example: ご飯を食べましょう (gohan wo tabemashou) - Let's eat

when_to_say: Used when referring to bread in any form.
example: 朝はパンを食べます (asa wa pan wo tabemasu) - I eat bread in the morning

when_to_say: Used when referring to meat in general.
example: 肉料理が好きです (niku ryouri ga suki desu) - I like meat dishes

when_to_say: Used when referring to fish as food or the animal.
example: 魚を買いました (sakana wo kaimashita) - I bought fish

when_to_say: Used when referring to vegetables in general.
example: 野菜を食べてください (yasai wo tabete kudasai) - Please eat vegetables

when_to_say: Used when referring to fruits in general.
example: 果物が好きですか (kudamono ga suki desu ka) - Do you like fruit?

when_to_say: Used when expressing that food tastes good.
example: とても美味しいです (totemo oishii desu) - It's very delicious

when_to_say: Used when referring to an educational institution.
example: 学校に行きます (gakkou ni ikimasu) - I go to school

when_to_say: Used when referring to a house or one's home.
example: 家に帰ります (ie ni kaerimasu) - I'm going home

when_to_say: Used when referring to a train or subway station.
example: 駅はどこですか (eki wa doko desu ka) - Where is the station?

when_to_say: Used when referring to a shop or store.
example: この店は安いです (kono mise wa yasui desu) - This shop is cheap

when_to_say: Used when referring to a medical hospital.
example: 病院に行きました (byouin ni ikimashita) - I went to the hospital

when_to_say: Used when indicating the right direction.
example: 右に曲がってください (migi ni magatte kudasai) - Please turn right

when_to_say: Used when indicating the left direction.
example: 左に見えます (hidari ni miemasu) - You can see it on the left

when_to_say: Used when describing something as being close in distance.
example: 駅は近いです (eki wa chikai desu) - The station is close

when_to_say: Used when describing something as being far in distance.
example: 空港は遠いです (kuukou wa tooi desu) - The airport is far

when_to_say: Used when referring to a road, street, or path.
example: 道を教えてください (michi wo oshiete kudasai) - Please tell me the way

when_to_say: Used when expressing movement from one place to another.
example: 学校に行きます (gakkou ni ikimasu) - I go to school

when_to_say: Used when expressing movement toward the speaker.
example: 友達が来ます (tomodachi ga kimasu) - My friend is coming

when_to_say: Used when describing the action of eating.
example: 昼ご飯を食べます (hirugohan wo tabemasu) - I eat lunch

when_to_say: Used when describing the action of drinking.
example: コーヒーを飲みます (koohii wo nomimasu) - I drink coffee

when_to_say: Used when describing the action of seeing or watching.
example: テレビを見ます (terebi wo mimasu) - I watch TV

when_to_say: Used when describing listening, hearing, or asking.
example: 音楽を聞きます (ongaku wo kikimasu) - I listen to music

when_to_say: Used when describing the action of reading.
example: 本を読みます (hon wo yomimasu) - I read books

when_to_say: Used when describing the action of writing.
example: 手紙を書きます (tegami wo kakimasu) - I write a letter

when_to_say: Used when describing the action of speaking or talking.
example: 日本語を話します (nihongo wo hanashimasu) - I speak Japanese

when_to_say: Used when describing the action of studying.
example: 毎日勉強します (mainichi benkyou shimasu) - I study every day

when_to_say: Used when describing something as large in size.
example: 大きい家です (ookii ie desu) - It's a big house

when_to_say: Used when describing something as small in size.
example: 小さい犬がいます (chiisai inu ga imasu) - There's a small dog

when_to_say: Used when describing something as new or recent.
example: 新しい車を買いました (atarashii kuruma wo kaimashita) - I bought a new car

when_to_say: Used when describing something as old or aged.
example: 古い建物です (furui tatemono desu) - It's an old building

when_to_say: Used when describing something as good or positive.
example: 良い天気ですね (ii tenki desu ne) - It's good weather, isn't it?

when_to_say: Used when describing something as bad or negative.
example: 天気が悪いです (tenki ga warui desu) - The weather is bad

when_to_say: Used when describing something as high, tall, or expensive.
example: この時計は高いです (kono tokei wa takai desu) - This watch is expensive

when_to_say: Used when describing something as cheap or inexpensive.
example: 安いレストランを知っています (yasui resutoran wo shitte imasu) - I know a cheap restaurant

when_to_say: Used when describing hot weather or temperature.
example: 今日は暑いです (kyou wa atsui desu) - It's hot today

when_to_say: Used when describing cold weather or feeling cold.
example: 冬は寒いです (fuyu wa samui desu) - Winter is cold

when_to_say: Used when referring to color in general.
example: 何色が好きですか (nani iro ga suki desu ka) - What color do you like?

when_to_say: Used when referring to the color red.
example: 赤い花が好きです (akai hana ga suki desu) - I like red flowers

when_to_say: Used when referring to the color blue.
example: 青い空です (aoi sora desu) - It's a blue sky

when_to_say: Used when referring to the color white.
example: 白い猫がいます (shiroi neko ga imasu) - There's a white cat

when_to_say: Used when referring to the color black.
example: 黒い服を着ています (kuroi fuku wo kite imasu) - I'm wearing black clothes

when_to_say: Used when referring to a book.
example: 本を読みます (hon wo yomimasu) - I read a book

when_to_say: Used when referring to a desk or table for work/study.
example: 机の上に本があります (tsukue no ue ni hon ga arimasu) - There's a book on the desk

when_to_say: Used when referring to a chair.
example: 椅子に座ってください (isu ni suwatte kudasai) - Please sit on the chair

when_to_say: Used when referring to a bag or briefcase.
example: 鞄を持っています (kaban wo motte imasu) - I'm carrying a bag

when_to_say: Used when referring to a mobile phone or cellphone.
example: 携帯を忘れました (keitai wo wasuremashita) - I forgot my mobile phone

when_to_say: Used when talking about weather conditions.
example: 今日の天気はどうですか (kyou no tenki wa dou desu ka) - How's the weather today?

when_to_say: Used when referring to rain.
example: 雨が降っています (ame ga futte imasu) - It's raining

when_to_say: Used when referring to snow.
example: 雪が降りました (yuki ga furimashita) - It snowed

when_to_say: Used when referring to wind.
example: 風が強いです (kaze ga tsuyoi desu) - The wind is strong

when_to_say: Used when describing sunny or clear weather.
example: 明日は晴れです (ashita wa hare desu) - Tomorrow will be sunny

when_to_say: Used when describing cloudy weather.
example: 今日は曇りです (kyou wa kumori desu) - It's cloudy today

when_to_say: Used when referring to a mountain.
example: 山に登りました (yama ni noborimashita) - I climbed a mountain

when_to_say: Used when referring to the sea or ocean.
example: 海に行きたいです (umi ni ikitai desu) - I want to go to the sea

when_to_say: Used when referring to a river.
example: 川で泳ぎました (kawa de oyogimashita) - I swam in the river

when_to_say: Used when referring to flowers.
example: 綺麗な花ですね (kirei na hana desu ne) - It's a beautiful flower, isn't it?

when_to_say: Used when expressing understanding or comprehension.
example: 日本語が分かりますか (nihongo ga wakarimasu ka) - Do you understand Japanese?

when_to_say: Used when expressing that something has been forgotten.
example: 名前を忘れました (namae wo wasuremashita) - I forgot the name

when_to_say: Used when expressing memorization or remembering.
example: 単語を覚えます (tango wo oboemasu) - I memorize vocabulary

when_to_say: Used when expressing teaching or telling someone something.
example: 日本語を教えてください (nihongo wo oshiete kudasai) - Please teach me Japanese

when_to_say: Used when something begins on its own.
example: 授業が始まります (jugyou ga hajimarimasu) - The class is starting

when_to_say: Used when something ends or finishes on its own.
example: 仕事が終わりました (shigoto ga owarimashita) - Work finished

meaning: to do one's best / try hard
when_to_say: Used when encouraging effort or persistence.
example: 頑張ってください (ganbatte kudasai) - Please do your best!

when_to_say: Used when expressing fatigue or tiredness.
example: とても疲れました (totemo tsukaremashita) - I'm very tired

when_to_say: Used when describing something as fun or enjoyable.
example: パーティーは楽しかったです (paatii wa tanoshikatta desu) - The party was fun

when_to_say: Used when describing something as difficult or hard.
example: 日本語は難しいです (nihongo wa muzukashii desu) - Japanese is difficult
